title: and section 292 (amended by section 1 of the Social Welfare (Child Benefit) Act
heading: 3. (1) This article applies to a person who is, or becomes, entitled to receive
text_raw:
3. (1) This article applies to a person who is, or becomes, entitled to receive 

a child support payment in respect of the relevant week. 

(2) 

(a) Subject to paragraph (b), in the case of a person to whom subarticle (1) applies, the amount payable to that person in respect of 
the relevant week shall be increased by €100.00 in respect of each 
qualified child. 

(b) 

In the case of a recipient of back to work family dividend, the 
amount payable to that person in respect of the relevant week 
shall be increased by €100.00 in respect of each child, to a 
maximum of 4 such children associated with that person’s back 
to work family dividend claim. 

 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform, consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for a once-off bonus payment of €100.00 to recipients 
of certain social welfare payments, in any case where a recipient is in receipt of 
a Child Support Payment (previously known as Increase for a Qualified Child). 
The once-off bonus is payable during the week commencing 18 November 2024. 

A recipient of the following listed social welfare payments, who has a qualified 
child or children, is entitled to an increase in the Child Support Payment for each 
qualified child — 

(a) 

illness benefit, in the case of a person whose aggregate period on 
this payment, including periods in receipt of partial capacity 
benefit, is not less than 312 days, 

(b) health and safety benefit, 

(c) 

jobseeker’s benefit, 

(d) 

jobseeker’s benefit (self-employed), 

(e) 

(f) 

disablement pension, 

death benefit payable as a pension to the widow or widower of an 
insured person, 

(g) 

carer’s benefit, 

(h) State pension (contributory), 

(i) 

invalidity pension, 

(j) widow’s (contributory) pension, 

(k) widower’s (contributory) pension, 

(l) 

surviving civil partner’s (contributory) pension, 

(m) 

jobseeker’s allowance, 

(n) State pension (non-contributory), 

(o) blind pension, 

(p) one-parent family payment, 

(q) deserted wife’s benefit, 

(r) 

(s) 

(t) 

(u) 

(v) 

carer’s allowance, 

supplementary welfare allowance payable in accordance with 
section 197(1) of the Act, 

disability allowance, 

farm assist, 

jobseeker’s benefit (self-employed) 
jobseeker’s benefit or 
payable in accordance with sub-article (c) of article 52HA of the

Social Welfare Consolidated (Claims Payments and Control) 
Regulations 2007. 

Recipients of back to work family dividend will also receive the increase for 
each child, to a maximum of 4 such children, associated with their back to work 
family dividend claim.
